text:
Yes split that joint fidelity account 50/50. All other accounts will be frozen, including fidelity with msft stock, retirement accounts, hsa accounts etc,
so no further stock sales or movement of money out.
The amount we receive now will be factored in once we finalize the final asset split.
The amount we receive will be used by each of us to pay our own expenses moving forward. You pay your rent, upkeep of rental, insurance, food,
clothing, etc. Yes I pay for my Botox, and other personal expenses including home mortgage payment, clothing etc
At final settlement, we will settle up anything that was paid individually that should have been borne by the other party.
Kid related expenses will be split temporarily 50/50. We will need to align what these are like tuition, camp fees, school related expenses etc. my
suggestion is we both deposit an equal agreed upon amount from our split of funds, into the jt BofA bank account, and only use that for kids
expenses. Ie monthly tuition payments due starting July. No personal spend from that account or it will need to be reimbursed.
My income is my separate income, as is any income you may earn, and will be deposited into our separate accounts.
I will stop college contributions for the kids and savings into Vanguard until we can align what are contribution should be.
I believe the cash deposit from your Deferred Comp plan was earned during the marriage, as are your remaining RSUs that are vesting. Those should
be preserved until final asset split. I will treat the vesting Sbux RSUs granted during our marriage the same way. How these are treated will be finalized
in the split.

You were talking about something else.
